DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scanner Device Last Validation Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of the last quality control calibration was performed on the positron emission tomography scanner used to obtain the image represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Device Events Domain Positron Emission Tomography Scanner Device Last Validation Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device events._A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to device events.

Property.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scanner Device Last Validation Date
Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.:The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
